unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Sparking Diwali Cheer**
normalised: **Energy and Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Sparking Diwali Cheer**

unnormalised: Good news for all you eco-warriors in Chennai and beyond! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is still offering sweet subsidies on solar rooftop installations, and folks are rushing to grab them before Diwali. Think about it – generating your own power and cutting down on those hefty electricity bills!
normalised: Good news for all you eco-warriors in Chennai and beyond! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E) is still offering sweet subsidies on solar rooftop installations, and folks are rushing to grab them before Diwali. Think about it – generating your own power and cutting down on those hefty electricity bills!

unnormalised: The subsidy covers residential, commercial, and even some industrial rooftops. Word on the street (or should we say, on the WhatsApp groups?) is that you can get up to 40% subsidy for systems up to 3kW. Anything bigger than that gets a bit less, but it's still a fantastic deal.
normalised: The subsidy covers residential, commercial, and even some industrial rooftops. Word on the street (or should we say, on the WhatsApp groups?) is that you can get up to forty percent subsidy for systems up to three kilowatt. Anything bigger than that gets a bit less, but it's still a fantastic deal.

unnormalised: Local installers in Kerala are reporting a surge in inquiries, likely fuelled by the promise of a greener Onam season next year. Imagine powering your entire Onam Sadhya spread with sunshine!
normalised: Local installers in Kerala are reporting a surge in inquiries, likely fuelled by the promise of a greener Onam season next year. Imagine powering your entire Onam Sadhya spread with sunshine!

unnormalised: However, experts from IIT-Delhi are advising everyone to do their homework. "Don't just jump at the first offer," says Dr. Sharma. "Compare quotes, check panel quality, and understand the terms and conditions." Apparently, some fly-by-night operators are trying to cash in.
normalised: However, experts from I I T-Delhi are advising everyone to do their homework. "Don't just jump at the first offer," says Doctor Sharma. "Compare quotes, check panel quality, and understand the terms and conditions." Apparently, some fly-by-night operators are trying to cash in.

unnormalised: Rs. 10,000 saved is Rs. 10,000 earned, right? Happy investing, and happy (solar-powered) Diwali!
normalised: Rupees ten thousand saved is rupees ten thousand earned, right? Happy investing, and happy (solar-powered) Diwali!
